meanings.definition: Not loud enough to be heard
meanings.sent1: She spoke in a subvocal tone so as not to disturb the sleeping baby.
meanings.sent2: The subvocal whispers in the library were barely audible.
meanings.sent3: The subvocal conversation between the two friends made others curious.
meanings.sent4: Her subvocal apology was drowned out by the noisy crowd.
meanings.sent5: The subvocal music playing in the background created a calming atmosphere.

meanings.definition: Involving or using silent articulation of speech sounds
meanings.sent1: The subvocal exercises helped improve her pronunciation.
meanings.sent2: He practiced subvocal speech to enhance his public speaking skills.
meanings.sent3: The subvocal practice session felt like a secret language class.
meanings.sent4: Her subvocal recitation of the poem was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The subvocal communication through eye contact was enough to convey their thoughts.
